description: A knight in full armor tells his opponent, also in armor but notably missing his head, to surrender because he has lost the duel. This presents a surreal image of continued combat despite a fatal blow. The absurdity stems from the intact knight's literal interpretation of the situation as a strategic defeat rather than a physical incapacitation resulting from decapitation. The irony lies in the formality of declaring victory to a literally headless opponent. The scene underscores the bizarre rituals of dueling.
caption: “Give up, Sir James. ... You’ve lost.”
